author: greystroke
content: It seems most the discussions of L1 execution scaling in the next couple upgrades focus mainly on default gas limit increases and optimizing the protocol to accommodate them. However,  I think even a modest reduction to even 9s L1 slot times in Glamsterdam should be considered (my understanding it easier to reduce to a slot time # divisible by 3 per the spec) .  It  would improve user UX, enhance base rollup sequencing, decrease mev and help with the ecosystem L1 scaling narrative.  This assumes it can be done safely and not kick off too many home stakers within the specs of eip-9270.

author: sky.cactus
content: I wouldn't be against this if block size was disconnect from slot time (e.g., gas per second instead of gas per block).  This way the decision about slot time could be made independent of decisions about resource utilization over time.  At the moment, the way we configure things makes the two intertwined but there is really little reason to have them be dependent on each other.

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> we should make the configuration be gas/s and not per block

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> and I agree that a slot time reduction for Glamsterdam would be very valuable

author: notnotstorm
content: how much can slot time be reduced? performance testnets focused on slot time will reveal the answer. we need nets that don't just have configurable slot time, but slot time that can hot swapped without downtime
